Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of High-Dose Magnesium Sulfate Infusion for Opioid-Sparing Analgesia in Pediatric Transplant Recipients

Trial_Design.evidence: prospective trial with a retrospective control group

Participants.evidence: participants aged 3–18 years undergoing total pancreatectomy with islet cell autotransplantation or liver transplantation

Intervention.evidence: The intervention involved a MgSO4 bolus (50 mg/kg) followed by an infusion (15 mg/kg/h) for up to 48 hours.

Objective.evidence: This trial evaluated the feasibility of high-dose magnesium sulfate (MgSO4) infusion for analgesia in pediatric transplant recipients.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was oral morphine equivalent (OME) per kg per day during the PICU stay.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and blinding details were not applicable.

Blinding.evidence: Randomisation and blinding details were not applicable.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Eleven patients were enrolled from July 2020 to December 2022.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The treatment group showed a trend towards higher intravenous fluid requirement (~1 bolus) but no increase in blood product use.

Harms.evidence: No serious adverse events were reported.

Funding.evidence: Funding: University of Minnesota Department of Pediatrics.
